result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L. Flint was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed/stayed with huber and 0 days credit.
Conditions:  Pay costs.  Attend AODA and follow terms and conditions as well as any treatment ordered by probation agent.  Submit to DNA test.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L. Flint

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue - Not Deliverable As Addressed, Unable to Forward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court with attorney Michael Yang. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for status today.  Counsel informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution calling for def's plea to the single count in the complaint; recommendation is for 120 days jail, imposed/stayed, for 1 year of probation with conditions of AODA, treatment, and costs.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea with def under oath.  Finding of guilty.  DA addresses the Court in support of the joint recommendation.  Court finds Chapter 971 victim's rights have been complied with.  Atty. Y addresses the Court in support of the joint recommendation.  Atty. Y also requests expungement upon successful completion of probation.  DA objects to expungement; notes that def committed a new crime while on probation in another matter.

Court follows joint recommendation and orders 120 days jail imposed and stayed for 1 year probation.  Conditions:  costs; attend AODA and follow terms and conditions as well as any treatment ordered by probation agent; submit to DNA test.  Court does not allow for expungement.
Status conference on March 15, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

ADA Forehand for the State.  Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court. Attorney Michael Yang appeared by phone means for Defendant Kevin L. Flint.  Further status requested; set for 3/15 at 1:15.  By that time, Court demands response from Atty. Forehand as to whether offer was accepted; then, 3/15 time will be used for plea/sentencing; if matter is not settled and ready for plea/sentencing, Court orders all motions filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Atty. Yang asked that Def call him.  Def stated he would.
Status conference on January 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Michael Yang appeared by phone means for Defendant Kevin L. Flint. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court.  Atty. Yang asks for additional time to discuss the case with his client and the DA and for review of discovery; asks for 60-90 days.  Yang states that he'll file his discovery demand today.  DA asks what def has to do to get license back.  Atty. Y not certain.  DA has no objection to 90 days out.  Jan. 11 at 2.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Def's request to waive the DNA surcharge
Status conference on October 28, 2016 at 09:15 am.

(case was filed under Judge Koehler's code; Judge K conducted the initial but filing official was Judge Sharp)

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court, accompanied by Atty. Lisa McDougal.  Atty. McDougal was present with def as counsel in 16CT60, however, does NOT represent in this case; has stated that the SPD will appoint counsel.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  NG plea entered by the Court on def's behalf.

Judge Sharp has recused in this case.  DCA will reassign judge and def will be notified of that assignment as well as the next date.
